, Fiat boss Sergio Marchionne said in remarks on Feb. 5. His comments on were quoted by Italy's Corriere della Sera, prompting the mayor of Turin, Fiat's birthplace, to demand "immediate clarification." It's clear that an international group can have several offices but it would be different if the headquarters were in the United States, Sergio Marchionne said. A number of leading politicians also expressed indignation, and ANSA news agency said talks were planned next week between Sergio Marchionne and Economic Development Minister Paolo Romani . smartphones to Google Apps and its other technologies. Google is moving that needle forward in 2011. Eric Schmidt wrote in the Harvard Business Review that all of Google's initiatives for year are mobile-centric. We are at the point where, between the geolocation capability of the phone and the power of the phone's browser platform, it is possible to deliver personalized information about where you are, what you could do there right now, and so forth-- and to deliver such a service at scale. Eric Schmidt is, of course, referencing Google's contextual discovery capability, where the search engine without prompting sends users recommendations when it detects through a user's mobile phones that they are in close proximity to something
